H310.def: = the side or part of something away from the spectator or from the direction in which it moves or faces

H7414.def: = an elevation of the earth’s surface rising gradually and to a relatively small height from the surrounding level; generally lower than a {L:mountain<SDBH:הַר>}

H631.def: = causative action by which humans tie (part of) the body of (other) humans or animals with a rope, cord, or chain ► in order to keep them under control

H246.def: = chains or shackles attached to the feet of a captive, ► to restrain his movements

H1546.def: = causative action by which a group of people is forced to leave their country to settle somewhere else for an indefinite amount of time

H3389.def: = town, formerly referred to as {L:Salem<SDBH:שָׁלֵם>} and {L:Jebus<SDBH:יְבוּס>};◄ located on Mt. {L:Zion<SDBH:צִיֹּון>}; territory of {L:Judah<SDBH:יְהוּדָה>}; ► conquered by king {L:David<SDBH:דָּוִד>}, who made it the capital of his kingdom

H4709.def: = town, also known as {L:Mizpeh<SDBH:מִצְפֶּה>}; ◄ in {L:Gilead<SDBH:גִּלְעָד>}; ► location where {L:Jacob<SDBH:יַעֲקֹב>} and {L:Laban<SDBH:לָבָן>} built a monument after their reconciliation; also residence of {L:Jephthah<SDBH:יִפְתָּח>}

H622.def: = process by which humans come together from different places and form a group for a common purpose, such as for a meeting or for war

H3196.def: = dark red alcoholic liquid; ◄ made out of grapes through the process of fermentation; ► used as beverage, though to be avoided by Nazirites, and by priests when on duty; ≈ associated with joy and well-being, but also with drunkenness and foolishness; used as metaphor for anger, aggressive behavior, and sex{N:001}

H7019.def: = hot season of the year, opposite of {L:חֹרֶף<SDBH:חֹרֶף>}; ► time when most crops are harvested and preparations are made for the cold season; ≈ sometimes associated with excessive heat and drought, and also with hard work

111.dom: Names of People|Names of Groups|Names of Locations

H7143.def: = man; ► father of {L:Johanan<SDBH:יֹוחָנָן>}, an army officer of {L:Judah<SDBH:יְהוּדָה>}, supporter of {L:Gedaliah<SDBH:גְּדַלְיָהוּ>}, the {L:Babylonian<SDBH:בָּבֶל>} appointed Governor of {L:Jerusalem<SDBH:יְרוּשָׁלַ͏ִם>}, during the time of the exile

H8269.def: = someone in a position of authority in an army, at a royal court, of a town, within a family, among priests, or elsewhere

H834.def: = a linker introducing a proposition that gives additional information regarding an explicit or implicit object, location, time, or manner

H7704.def: = a piece of land generally uninhabited by human beings, but where one can find wild animals and plants and trees; consists of grasslands, fields, desert, or forest; can be used for farming, pasturing animals, and hunting; often used in contrast to inhabited land such as cities or encampments.

H4709.def: = town, also known as {L:Mizpeh<SDBH:מִצְפֶּה>}; ◄ in {L:Gilead<SDBH:גִּלְעָד>}; ► location where {L:Jacob<SDBH:יַעֲקֹב>} and {L:Laban<SDBH:לָבָן>} built a monument after their reconciliation; also residence of {L:Jephthah<SDBH:יִפְתָּח>}

H559.def: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken

H3045.def: = process by which humans or deities acquire information about other humans, deities, or certain facts, which is stored in the mind

H1185.def: = man; ► king of {L:Ammon<SDBH:עַמֹּון>}; time of exile

H4428.def: = supreme secular and male ruler of a nation or people; ≈ associated with authority, power, honor, but also with justice; also used as a reference to one's deity

H5983.def: = nation; ◄ situated E. of river {L:Jordan<SDBH:יַרְדֵּן>}; according to {S:00101903800100200} founded by {L:Ben-Ammi<SDBH:בֶּן־עַמִּי>}, son of {L:Lot<SDBH:לֹוט>}

H7971.def: = causative action by which humans or deities commission one or more agents to go to a certain individual or place in order to perform a certain task

H853.def: exact meaning unknown; possibly: = wooden handle with an iron head that has both an adze and a chisel as its ends; ► used for breaking up moderately hard soil to make it ready for cultivation

H5315.def: = the part of the body connecting the head to the rest of the body and containing the passageways for blood, air, and food; ≈ associated with breathing, appetite, and life and often used metonymically to refer to the entire body and the personality inhabiting it

H296.def: = man; ◄ son of {L:Shaphan<SDBH:שָׁפָן>}; ► official; time of king {L:Josiah<SDBH:יֹאשִׁיָּהוּ>}; father of {L:Gedaliah<SDBH:גְּדַלְיָהוּ>}, governor of {L:Judah<SDBH:יְהוּדָה>}, time of exile

H539.def: = state in which an inanimate object is firmly positioned in its place, so that it will not move

H7143.def: = man; ► father of {L:Johanan<SDBH:יֹוחָנָן>}, an army officer of {L:Judah<SDBH:יְהוּדָה>}, supporter of {L:Gedaliah<SDBH:גְּדַלְיָהוּ>}, the {L:Babylonian<SDBH:בָּבֶל>} appointed Governor of {L:Jerusalem<SDBH:יְרוּשָׁלַ͏ִם>}, during the time of the exile

H559.def: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken

H4709.def: = town, also known as {L:Mizpeh<SDBH:מִצְפֶּה>}; ◄ in {L:Gilead<SDBH:גִּלְעָד>}; ► location where {L:Jacob<SDBH:יַעֲקֹב>} and {L:Laban<SDBH:לָבָן>} built a monument after their reconciliation; also residence of {L:Jephthah<SDBH:יִפְתָּח>}

H1980.def: = process by which liquids or other inanimate objects move from one place to another

H853.def: exact meaning unknown; possibly: = wooden handle with an iron head that has both an adze and a chisel as its ends; ► used for breaking up moderately hard soil to make it ready for cultivation

H3045.def: = process by which humans or deities acquire information about other humans, deities, or certain facts, which is stored in the mind

H4100.def: = a reference to an unknown object or event; normally used with the purpose of identifying that object; sometimes used in rhetorical questions expressing one's conviction that that object or event cannot be identified

H5315.def: = the part of the body connecting the head to the rest of the body and containing the passageways for blood, air, and food; ≈ associated with breathing, appetite, and life and often used metonymically to refer to the entire body and the personality inhabiting it

H3063.def: = man, tribe, and territory; ◄ fourth son of {L:Jacob<SDBH:יַעֲקֹב>} and {L:Leah<SDBH:לֵאָה>}; ► founder of one of the tribes of {L:Israel<SDBH:יִשְׂרָאֵל>}, which became a separate kingdom (opposed to Israel) after the death of {L:Solomon<SDBH:שְׁלֹמֹה>}, and, after the exile, a separate administrative district

H6908.def: = action by which humans or animals come together as a group for a common purpose

H6.def: = state of not being located in the place where it is expected to be

301.dom: Names of People|Names of Groups|Names of Locations

H296.def: = man; ◄ son of {L:Shaphan<SDBH:שָׁפָן>}; ► official; time of king {L:Josiah<SDBH:יֹאשִׁיָּהוּ>}; father of {L:Gedaliah<SDBH:גְּדַלְיָהוּ>}, governor of {L:Judah<SDBH:יְהוּדָה>}, time of exile

H559.def: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken

H7143.def: = man; ► father of {L:Johanan<SDBH:יֹוחָנָן>}, an army officer of {L:Judah<SDBH:יְהוּדָה>}, supporter of {L:Gedaliah<SDBH:גְּדַלְיָהוּ>}, the {L:Babylonian<SDBH:בָּבֶל>} appointed Governor of {L:Jerusalem<SDBH:יְרוּשָׁלַ͏ִם>}, during the time of the exile

H6213.def: = causative action by which human or deities produce an object, either personally or by others on behalf of them

H853.def: exact meaning unknown; possibly: = wooden handle with an iron head that has both an adze and a chisel as its ends; ► used for breaking up moderately hard soil to make it ready for cultivation

H1696.def: = causative action by which someone exterminates a group of people, either directly or by the hands of someone else

H8267.def: = state in which humans are not committed towards fulfilling their obligations and show that by their actions
